body.section:
Apart from this documentation and commercial support, support can be obtained from the Hippo community:
Hippo ECM mailing list: if you subscribe to this mailing list, you can ask you questions here. Many other users and Hippo ECM developers will answer your questions. Allow for a few hours or days to receive answers. Allthough many questions are answered in the mailing list, no guarantees can be given.
Note that it is general mailing list etiquete to ask only after you checked that your question was not answered before. Checking for previously answered questions is done in the mailing list archive, see below.
CMS mailing list archive: The archive of all previously asked questions and their responses. Search in the archive for your question. In many cases you will find the answer to your question within a few minutes.
Hippo CMS issue tracker: Read here what issues the developers of Hippo CMS have been and are currently working on. Only Hippo developers and some partners can open issues in the issue tracker, but anyone can contact the developers by email. They are listed as administrators of the Hippo issue tracker at the Hippo issue tracker homepage, with their email adresses (see the bottom of the Login box).
Hippo CMS wiki: Sign up yourself and join the community effort to create more documentation. You can also just read the community created documentation. This is possible without signing up. You will find documenation written by other users and by Hippo developers.
